Write-Up Text: As they await the announcement of 2023's federal budget voters are discussing the government's plans to address the cost-of-living crisis and responses to the problem of sexual violence. Projections say the government's first surplus in 15 years will be due to the rising prices of iron ore coal and gas. Concerns have also been raised about the government's allocation of funds and its potential impact on inflation and Australians living in poverty. Despite differing opinions Australians look forward to seeing how the budget will impact various communities and industries.
